Dialogue: Breaking News: As of September 5th, 2017 DACA has been officially rescinded.
Deferred Action for Childhood Arrivals - better known as DACA - was first announced by President Barack Obama on June 15th, 2012.
The policy was not intended to give childhood arrivals a path to citizenship, instead, it was intended to grant them certain rights they would not otherwise have.
DACA recepients would be able to register for driver's licenses, social security numbers, and work permits.
With DACA's termination now, however, no new applications will be processed and only current applicants will be allowed to renew their applications for the future.
... That's the end of the broadcast.
